questions.question: How many access keys are provided for accessing your Azure storage account?
questions.fact: Each storage account has two access keys. This lets you follow the best-practice guideline of periodically replacing the key used by your applications without incurring downtime.

questions.question: What are blobs?
questions.answer: A Binary Large OBject (BLOB) is a collection of binary data.
questions.fact: Blobs are files for the cloud. Apps work with blobs in much the same way as they would work with files on a disk, like reading and writing data. However, unlike a local file, blobs can be reached from anywhere with an internet connection.

questions.question: Should the name of a Storage Account be globally unique?
questions.fact: Naming conventions are important to keep an overview of resources in Azure.
